name: A1
title: Google Account, Device information and usage

elements.name: A1_T1
elements.html:
In the following section, we will ask you some general questions related to your usage of Google services, your knowledge of Google Account features, and your current Google Account usage habits.

A “primary Google Account” refers to the Google (Gmail) account you use most frequently for your day-to-day online activities (such as email, Google Search, YouTube, Maps, Drive, or logging into apps/websites).

elements.name: A1_Q1
elements.title: How long have you been using your primary Google Account (on your laptop or Android smartphone)?

elements.name: A1_T2
elements.html: You may use your primary Google Account across different devices. Please tell us how long you have been using this account on the following devices:

elements.name: A1_Q2
elements.title: On your laptop/desktop browser (for logging into Google services such as Search, Drive, Gmail, YouTube, or Maps):

elements.name: A1_Q3
elements.title: On your Android smartphone (for logging into your phone or Google services such as Gmail, Play Store, Maps, YouTube, etc.):
choices: Do not use an Android smartphone

elements.name: A1_Q4
elements.title: Which of the following Google services have you ever used? (Select all that apply)
choices: Google Account Settings / Privacy & Personalization Page

elements.name: A1_Q5
elements.title: Which of the following Google services have you used the most in the last 2 years? (Select all that apply)
choices: Google Account Settings / Privacy & Personalization Page

elements.name: A1_Q6
elements.title: For what primary purposes do you use your Google Account? (Select all that apply)
choices: Web browsing and syncing across devices (Chrome)
Social media logins / Single Sign-On (“Sign in with Google”)

elements.name: A1_Q7
elements.title: On average, within a 24-hour period, approximately how many hours do you use any Google services while signed into your Google Account (across any device)?

elements.name: A1_Q8
elements.title: Do you know what “Chrome Sync” is?

elements.name: A1_Q9
elements.title: Do you keep Chrome Sync turned on across your devices?

elements.name: A1_T3
elements.html:
Don’t know about Chrome Sync?

Chrome Sync is a feature of the Google Chrome browser that allows users to synchronize their browsing data across devices when they are signed into their Google Account. When Chrome Sync is enabled, data such as browsing history, bookmarks, saved passwords, autofill information, open tabs, extensions, and browser settings can be automatically shared across all devices where the same account is signed in. This provides convenience by allowing a seamless browsing experience across devices. However, enabling Chrome Sync means that the synced data may be stored in your Google Account, and accessing a device where you are signed in may expose your synced browsing information to others who use that device.

elements.name: A1_Q10
elements.title: If given a choice, would you prefer to keep Chrome Sync enabled on your devices?

elements.name: A1_Q11
elements.title: Have you ever explored or modified your Google Account settings (e.g., privacy settings, security settings, personalization)?
choices: I am aware of them but have never explored
I was not aware these settings existed

elements.name: A1_Q12
elements.title: Which of the following Google services do you use most frequently? (Select all that apply)

elements.name: A1_Q13
elements.title: Which is the one Google service you use the most from the above?

elements.name: A1_Q14
elements.title: From where do you mostly use these Google services?

elements.name: A1_Q15
elements.title: Do you ever use “Sign in with Google” to log into third-party applications and websites?

elements.name: A1_Q16
elements.title: Before allowing a website or app to connect to your Google Account using “Sign in with Google”, how often do you review the permissions requested (e.g., access to profile, email, contacts, Drive files)?

elements.name: A1_Q17_ACK1
elements.title: What is the shape of a red ball?

elements.name: A1_Q18
elements.title: Have you ever refused to use “Sign in with Google” for an app or service, even though it was convenient, due to privacy concerns?

elements.name: A1_Q19
elements.title: Can you briefly (a couple of words) mention what kind of data associated with your Google Account you consider most private?

elements.name: A1_Q20
elements.title: Can you list the names of some Google services or connected apps that you feel might have access to your most private data?
elements.placeholder: e.g., Google Photos, Drive, third-party connected apps

elements.name: A1_Q21
elements.title: Do you use any of the following authentication mechanisms to secure your Google Account? (Select all that apply)

elements.name: A1_Q22
elements.title: Do you also use any of the following methods to conveniently stay signed in to Google across devices? (Select all that apply)
choices: I don’t use any such mechanisms

elements.name: A1_Q23
elements.title: Please tell us in brief (1–3 sentences) if you use any additional tools or mechanisms to protect the privacy of data associated with your Google Account. (Optional)
elements.placeholder: e.g., VPN, containerized browsing, extension names

elements.name: A1_Q24
elements.title: Are you currently using (or have previously used) any privacy or security-enhancing tools on your browser or devices while signed into Google?

elements.name: A1_Q25
elements.title: Have you ever heard of the Google Account “My Activity” dashboard before the screening survey?

elements.name: A1_Q26
elements.title: Please choose the ecosystem that best describes the device you primarily use to access Google services.

elements.name: A2_intro_MyActivity
elements.html:
In the following section, we will ask you some general questions to learn more about your knowledge of the Google “My Activity” dashboard in general and your usage of this feature in particular.

The Google “My Activity” dashboard is a service provided by Google that allows users to view, manage, and delete the activity data collected from their use of various Google services (such as Search, YouTube, Maps, Chrome, and more). “My Activity” organizes your past activity in a timeline and gives you control over what data is stored in your Google Account.

  • You can access the Google “My Activity” dashboard by visiting https://myactivity.google.com/ while signed into your Google Account.
  • You can also find it by going to your Google Account → Data & Privacy → History settings → My Activity.
  • “My Activity” allows you to view activity by date, Google product, and category. You can also delete specific items, delete activity in bulk, or turn on auto-delete for future activity.
You can learn more about the Google “My Activity” dashboard from the official help page: Click here

elements.name: A2_Q1
elements.title: Which of the following best describes your level of familiarity with the Google “My Activity” dashboard?
choices: I have never heard of/noticed the Google “My Activity” dashboard before
I know somewhat about it but have never used it before
I know somewhat about it and have used it before
I know a lot about it but have never used it before
I know a lot about it and have used it before

elements.name: A2_Q2
elements.title: Since how long have you been aware of the Google “My Activity” dashboard?

elements.name: A2_Q3
elements.title: On which device(s) do you primarily access the Google “My Activity” dashboard? (Select all that apply)
choices: I do not use the “My Activity” dashboard

elements.name: A2_Q4_ACK2
elements.title: This study focuses on users’ interactions with?

elements.name: A2_Q5
elements.title: How often do you access your Google “My Activity” dashboard?
choices: A couple of times per month
A couple of times per year

elements.name: A2_Q6
elements.title: What qualities of the Google “My Activity” dashboard encourage you to use it regularly? (Select all that apply)
elements.visibleIf: {A2_Q5} = 'Multiple times a week' or {A2_Q4_AccessFrequency} = 'Once a week' or {A2_Q5} = 'A couple of times per month'
choices: I find it easy to use and navigate
It helps me keep track of what Google knows about me
I find the delete or auto-delete options useful
It gives me a sense of control over my data
It helps improve my privacy or security

elements.name: A2_Q7
elements.title: What qualities discourage you from using the Google “My Activity” dashboard regularly? (Select all that apply)
elements.visibleIf: {A2_Q5} = 'Once a month' or {A2_Q5} = 'A couple of times per year' or {A2_Q5} = 'Less than once per year' or {A2_Q5} = 'Never'
choices: I find it confusing or difficult to navigate
I do not understand what is stored there
I do not find it useful
It feels overwhelming due to too much data
I am concerned I might delete something important
I do not think I need to review it

elements.name: A2_Q8
elements.title: For what purposes do you use the Google “My Activity” dashboard? (Select all that apply)
elements.description: To know more about what you can do with “My Activity”, you may check: support.google.com/accounts/answer/7028918
choices: Reviewing my past searches or activity
Checking if Google stored something unexpected
I do not use it for any specific purpose

elements.name: A2_Q9
elements.title: How do you generally access the Google “My Activity” dashboard when you want to use it? (Select all that apply)
choices: By typing “my activity” on Google Search
Through Google Account → Data & Privacy settings
Through direct bookmark or saved link
Through a suggestion or link inside a Google service (e.g., YouTube/Maps)
I do not use the “My Activity” dashboard

elements.name: A2_Q10
elements.title: Do you think the Google “My Activity” dashboard presents your stored activity in a clear and understandable way?

elements.name: A2_Q11
elements.title: Do you recall changing any of the following default settings related to activity tracking in your Google Account? (Select all that apply)
choices: I do not recall changing any of these settings

elements.name: A2_Q12_ExploredDataPrivacySection
elements.title: Do you recall exploring the “Data & Privacy” section of your Google Account where “My Activity” settings are located?

name: B1
title: Usage of Google “My Activity” and Google services

elements.name: A3_T1
elements.html:
In the following section, we will ask you some general questions to learn more about your usage of the Google “My Activity” dashboard, as well as how you interact with Google services that contribute to your stored activity. We will also ask a few questions regarding your cross-device Google usage patterns.

A Google activity log refers to the information collected by Google based on your interactions with its products and services. This may include your searches, websites visited, apps used, videos watched, voice and audio interactions, location history, and other related activities. These activity logs are stored in your Google “My Activity” dashboard and may differ across devices and products. (See the figure below)

Figure: Example representation of Google activity logs

Below is some brief information to help you understand where activity logs come from and how they are stored:

  • Google stores activity when you use services such as Search, YouTube, Maps, Chrome, and others while signed into your Google Account.
  • Activity may also be stored from multiple devices simultaneously if the same Google Account is signed in.
  • You can view, delete, or manage these activities by visiting https://myactivity.google.com.
  • Activity logs may include timestamps, device details, product information, and, in some cases, content associated with your activity.

elements.name: A3_Q1
elements.title: Approximately how long ago did you create the primary Google Account that you currently use most often?

elements.name: A3_T2
elements.html: Before answering the next set of questions, please visit your Google “My Activity” dashboard (https://myactivity.google.com) and complete the short tasks below. This will help you recall what kind of information is stored in your account.

elements.name: A3_T3
elements.html:
Task Set 1: Visit and Explore Your Activity Dashboard

  1. Scroll through at least 20–25 activity entries from the most recent day.
  2. Observe the types of data stored (e.g., Search, YouTube, Maps, Ads, Android, Assistant, etc.).

elements.name: A3_Q2
elements.title: Verification Question: Please write the name of any one category of activity you saw the most (e.g., Search, YouTube, Maps).

elements.name: A3_T4
elements.html:
Task Set 2: Check Activity by Category

  1. Click on “Filter by date & product”.
  2. View activity for at least 3 different Google products (e.g., YouTube, Maps).

elements.name: A3_Q3
elements.title: Verification Question: Which 3 Google products did you check? (Select all that apply)

elements.name: A3_T5
elements.html:
Task Set 3: Explore Activity Over Time

  1. Use the date filter to view activity from: Today, Yesterday, and Last 30 days.

elements.name: A3_Q4
elements.title: Verification Question: Were there noticeable differences in the types of activity stored across time periods?
choices: Yes, the types of activity changed

elements.name: A3_T6
elements.html: Now that you have explored your Google “My Activity” dashboard and reviewed the types of data stored across products and time, we will ask you a few questions about your observations and experiences. Your responses should be based on what you just saw during the exploration tasks and your general awareness of how Google stores your activity data.

elements.name: A3_Q5
elements.title: What kind of information do you recall Google storing about your activity across its services? (Select all that apply)
choices: Basic profile information (such as name, birthday, phone number)
Most visited places (such as Home or Work)
Ads personalization interests or profile categories
Purchase or transaction details (e.g., through Google Search, Maps, or Play Store)
I don’t recall seeing any of the above information stored

elements.name: A3_Q6
elements.title: Do you recall seeing any activity in your Google “My Activity” dashboard that felt unnecessary, irrelevant, or meaningless to be stored?

elements.name: A3_Q7
elements.title: Do you recall noticing activity entries in your Google “My Activity” dashboard that you do not remember performing (e.g., accidental searches)?

elements.name: A3_Q8
elements.title: Do you recall ever seeing activity in your Google “My Activity” dashboard that you would consider inappropriate or embarrassing if someone else saw it?

elements.name: A3_Q9
elements.title: Do you think any person other than you might have generated activity in your Google Account at some point in time (e.g., using your device while logged in)?

elements.name: A3_Q10
elements.title: Can you please briefly (1–3 sentences) explain your answer choice for the previous question?

elements.name: A3_Q11
elements.title: Do you recall using your Google Account on a shared device (such as a family laptop, school/office computer, or friend’s phone) so that some of their activity may have been logged in the Google dashboard?

elements.name: A3_Q12
elements.title: Do you recall any instances where Google seemed to store activity that you did not intentionally perform (e.g., due to auto-sync, auto-login, or background data collection)?

elements.name: A3_Q13
elements.title: Do you think it is possible that some activity may have been logged in your Google Account without your explicit awareness (e.g., auto-sync across devices, accidental taps, background tracking)?

elements.name: A3_Q14
elements.title: Do you think that Google collects any kind of activity data while you are using its services (such as Search, YouTube, Maps, Chrome, etc.)?

elements.name: A3_Q15_ACK3
elements.title: AC_3 Select the option that contains exactly five letters.

elements.name: A3_Q16
elements.title: How comfortable would you feel if Google stored activity logs (e.g., search/query text, visited links, timestamps) from each of the scenarios listed below?

rows.text: When you searched or browsed casually for non-important topics
When you searched for personal or sensitive information (e.g., health, finances)
When you viewed content that may be personally embarrassing or private
When you used Google services while someone else was present nearby
When another person used a device where you were logged into your Google Account
When you used Google services in shared or public spaces
When activity was logged on a public or shared device (e.g., library, office, school computer)
When activity was logged accidentally or unintentionally (e.g., mistyped queries, accidental taps)

elements.name: A3_Q17
elements.title: Do you think that your Google activity logs could possibly contain any sensitive or personal information?

elements.name: A3_Q18
elements.title: Can you please briefly (1–3 sentences) explain your answer choice for the previous question?

elements.name: A3_Q19
elements.title: How comfortable would you feel if Google stored the detailed content of your activity (e.g., exact search queries, viewed links, watched videos) from each of the above scenarios?

rows.text: Casual or non-personal browsing/search activity
Searches or activity related to personal or sensitive topics (e.g., health, finances, relationships)
Activity related to content that could be embarrassing or private
Activity performed while someone else was present nearby
Activity performed by another person using a device where you were logged into your Google Account
Activity performed in environments with other people talking in the background
Activity logged on a shared or public device (e.g., school, office, café, library computer)
Activity logged accidentally or unintentionally (e.g., mis-clicks, accidental searches, auto-suggestions clicked by mistake)

elements.name: A3_Q20
elements.title: Do you think that the content of these activity logs could possibly contain any sensitive or personal information?

elements.name: A3_Q21
elements.title: Can you please briefly (1–3 sentences) explain your answer choice for the previous question?

elements.name: A3_Q22
elements.title: Would you be comfortable with Google storing this activity data (from each of the scenarios discussed above) in your Google Account?

elements.name: A3_Q23_ACK4
elements.title: If all Android users use Google Play Store, and Sam uses Google Play Store, what can you conclude?
choices: Sam is definitely an Android user
Sam is definitely not an Android user
Sam may or may not be an Android user

elements.name: A3_Q24
elements.title: For each of the following cases, when do you think it would be acceptable for Google to collect and store your activity data across its services (e.g., Search, YouTube, Maps, Chrome)?

rows.text: If you have explicitly consented to Google collecting your activity data
If Google does not notify you while collecting your activity data
If Google explicitly notifies you while collecting some/all of your activity data
If Google anonymizes (removes personally identifiable information from) your activity data before storing it
If you get financial rewards (in the form of discounts, gift cards, coupons, etc.) for allowing Google to store your activity data
If your activity data is used to improve the performance of Google services
If your activity data is used to develop new or personalized features for you
If your activity data is used to develop new features for the Google activity dashboard
If your activity data is stored indefinitely by Google on its data storage facilities
If your activity data is not stored indefinitely by Google on its data storage facilities

elements.name: A3_Q25
elements.title: Can you please briefly (1–3 sentences) explain your answer choices for the cases where you selected “Sometimes acceptable” or “Never acceptable” in the previous question?
